questions.question: You are not ………………….. to be a soldier.
I can’t tell you .....................… pleased I am about the result.

questions.question: I thought the house was ………………….. small.

questions.question: ...................... can you speak English?
questions.description: We can use how before gradable adjectives and adverbs to add the idea of degree.

questions.question: He is …………………. creative.
questions.description: We use ‘not very’ to express a low degree. Little is not possible with this meaning.

questions.question: Her condition is ...................... serious.
questions.description: Very is not normally used with much before adjectives and adverbs.

questions.question: You should come …………………. quickly as you can.

questions.question: I don’t care ..................... expensive it is.

questions.question: Today is ...................... colder than yesterday.
questions.description: Before comparative adjectives we can use very or very much.
